snippet: The difficult work of addressing the nation’s overreliance on opioids, while also treating debilitating pain, is playing out patient by patient in West Virginia.
abstract: Efforts by health care facilities in West Virginia, state that has been epicenter for opioid abuse, to deal with its disproportionately poor population's overreliance on pain-relieving drugs offers insight into larger struggle to contain national epidemic; more than 3,000 of 35,000 patients at Community Care of West Virginia have seen anesthesiologist Denzil Hawkinberry to treat debilitating pain while reducing their addiction to opioids.
lead_paragraph: The difficult work of addressing the nation’s overreliance on opioids, while also treating debilitating pain, is playing out patient by patient in West Virginia.

headline.main: Treating Pain Without Feeding Addiction at Epicenter for Opioids
headline.print_headline: Treating Pain Without Feeding the Epidemic of Opioid Addiction
